content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can write a function to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` representing the column name and returns a clean version of it. It lowercases the string, strips any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can call this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```
